events.name: IGDA pres. Gaming Game Conventions
events.description:
As conventions like Casual Connect Asia draw near, are attendees and exhibitors making the most out of these conventions? What's the difference between various global game conventions and what should attendees do before and after? Come attend this event to find out more about game conventions 101!

Agenda:
Intro to PIXEL
Best Practices Before and After Conventions
Speaker: Allan Simonsen (Boomzap)

[PANEL] Getting Noticed at Conventions: Media, virality, awards 
Speakers: Elicia Lee (Gamestart), Justin Ng (Gattai Games), Simon Davis (Mighty Bear), Desmond Wong (Gentlebros)

Beyond CCA: A World of Conferences
Speaker: Brian Kwek (Witching Hour Studios)

7:00pm - 7:30pm: Food & Mingling
7:30pm - 7:40pm: Opening and introduction to PIXEL
7:40pm - 8:10pm: Talk: Best Practices Before and After Conventions
8:10pm - 9:00pm: Panel: Getting Noticed at Conventions: Media, virality, awards
9:00pm - 9:30pm: Talk: Beyond CCA: A World of Conferences
9:30pm - 10:00pm: Mingling

events.name: Meet other mechanical keyboard enthusiasts. Bring your keyboards!
events.description: A must-attend for anyone who collects mechanical keyboards (IKBCs, Pokers, Corsairs, Das Keyboards, etc) or just wants to try them out before choosing their own. Bring your keycaps and keyboards and share the joy of the clackety clack with others too. There's free booze and snacks, so you can always just come by for a drink if you'd like. Starts at 7pm.
events.location: Spacemob Ascent, 2 Science Park Drive #02-05, Singapore 118222
events.group_name: Mechanical Keyboard Collectors and Users Meetup

events.name: TechLadies Study CS50 - 3 May
events.description:
Join us in this women-only study group to learn computer science! While there will be one or two mentors to answer any technical questions you have, you need to be self-reliant as much as possible as this is not a workshop. 

In this study group, we are taking the course, HarvardX: CS50 Introduction to Computer Science, on edX together. As long as you are taking this course, please join us even if you're just getting started! üë©üèª‚Äçüíª üí™

To join in this study group, please:

1. Create an account on edX and enroll into the course at this link: https://courses.edx.org/courses/course-v1:HarvardX+CS50+X/info

2. Start from Week 0 or continue where you've left off. As the free wifi we are tapping on at the cafes might sometimes not be that great, do watch the lecture videos before you come. 

Bring your fully charged laptop and we'll see you soon!

Note: Please buy something at the cafe as we're merely crashing that cafe. We don't want to be kicked out! We're trying out different cafes in search for the most ideal place (spacious, good wifi, convenient location). Until the search is over, do be prepared to tether from your phone when we meet.

Psst! This study group is for women only. :)
events.location: The Daily Roundup, 1 Keong Saik Road #01-02, Singapore 089109

events.name: DataJam!
events.description: We're looking to increase our contributions to the social sector here in Singapore, and will be having a monthly meeting for volunteers who want to do more. These will be working sessions which can include:¬† ‚Ä¢¬†DataJams where data is cleaned and prepped for further analysis,¬† ‚Ä¢¬†Clinics for social sector organisations to drop in and ask data-related questions, and ‚Ä¢ Planning sessions for wider community events.¬† Please understand that no food will be provided, so do make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, it would be great if you¬†bring your own water bottle along with your laptop and power cable too. Agenda 6.45 - 7pm: Registration7 - 7.30pm: Data review and task assignment7.30 - 9.30pm: Data cleaning
events.location: National Volunteer & Philanthropy Centre, 6 Eu Tong Sen Street #04-88 The Central Singapore 059817 (above Clarke Quay MRT Station)
